Mikkel, there has already been some work on NEAT with Othello:

http://cite=
seer.ist.psu.edu/512891.html

This paper is an undergrad research report of=
 an attempt to play
Othello with NEAT.  

What we ran into, which is a well=
-recognized challenge with NEAT, is
that the input and output spaces are to=
o large in Othello to start
minimally in the normal way.  If this problem i=
s not addressed in some
way, it is unlikely you will get very impressive re=
sults.  See the
following question in the NEAT FAQ:

"How can NEAT "start m=
inimally" in a high-input/high-output domain?" 

(The NEAT FAQ is available=
 at: 
http://www.cs.utexas.edu/users/kstanley/neat.html
..just search down =
for that particular question)

ken
